668162732.name: Alacranes National Park or Scorpion Reef
668162732.author: a TripAdvisor user
668162732.reviewBody: I have made somewhere between 150 and 200 trips out to Scorpion Reef.  I was captain of a 60 Striker and later a 72 Palmer Johnson sport fisherman.  It is 66 miles to Isla Perez on the south end and about 74 miles to Desterrada on the northern end.  There are 5 islands out there.  You can only camp on Isla Perez overnight.  The fishing is great but one needs to know how to fish.  There are plenty of birds that live out there.  One needs to be careful so that you don\u2019t lose your boat on a reef, very careful.  You need to buy your permit to enter the park before you go.  There is a daily fee per person.  The water visibility is very good usually 50 to 150 feet.  The reefs are incredible.  There is an arching reef on the east side of about 15 miles long that you can run a dingy aground on.  I used to troll for black groupers along the reef and the barracudas were thick along there as well.  We did catch occasional tunas, wahoo, king mackerel, African pompanos there trolling.  You can anchor and catch yellowtail snapper, triggerfish and groupers.  If you fish to the northwest, the water gets deep and you can catch blue marlin, white marlin, sailfish, dorados, wahoo and tunas.  Some days are better than others out there.  The wahoo and tunas are the thickest in September and October.  Most people go to enjoy the beaches and swimming and snorkeling and drinking and partying.  I like to fish.  It is the largest reef in the Gulf of Mexico.  It is unique and definitely worth seeing.  Most of my trips were 3 days and 2 nights.  I had an experienced fly fisherman and he caught somewhere between 50 and 100 fish on his fly rod in April on Isla Pereez walking and casting his flys.  It is an adventure and a major expedition.

668123582.name: A very beautiful walk along the oceanfront.
668123582.author: a TripAdvisor user
668123582.reviewBody: Many good restaurants and shops along the way.  Great people watching - cruiseships visit often.  Relaxing ocean breezes.

666346933.name: nice
666346933.author: a TripAdvisor user
666346933.reviewBody: Malecon is the boardwalk of Progreso, walking along the beach, lots of restaurants and crafts sellers. is a nice walk where you can take great pictures and see the port of progreso where cruises often arrive for a day.

661924212.name: Bored??  Hit the Malecon Boardwalk!!!
661924212.author: a TripAdvisor user
661924212.reviewBody: Just came back from a trip to Chelem Mexico and had the opportunity of taking a couple trips to the Malecon.  Absolutely stunning.  You can watch the cruise ships come in to the longest pier you\'ve ever seen every few days or so and people watch till your hearts content.  If shopping is your thing there is everything you can imagine available to purchase.  I recommend the Leather Store.  Amazing selection of wallets, bags, backpacks around.  And, of course, the food.  Ohhhhh the food.  Take your pick, it\'s deeeeeelish.  A must if your anywhere near this area.

660589298.name: Cruise day trip
660589298.author: a TripAdvisor user
660589298.reviewBody: We took the fre shuttle from th cruise ship to this beach.  We we\'re initially unsure as they dropped us in a square and it was run down.  Found our way to this beach and was greeted by a friendly man that sold us 2 chairs for the day and an umbrella. $25 and came with bathroom access and chips and salsa at the restaurant across the way.  Beach was covered in items washed ashore over night.  I was initially concerned but they did a great job cleaning it up.  There were good waves and lots of beautiful shells.  Lots of vendors constantly approaching us to sell goods which is typical of spots like this.  Overall a good stop.

656172460.name: Popular for families
656172460.author: a TripAdvisor user
656172460.reviewBody: On cruise ship days the Malecon is busy with tourists and vendors that set up for the tourists.  On the weekends a totally different atmosphere with town people and I anymore sure visitors from Merida come to enjoy the beach and the restaurants. it is a safe and friendly place to enjoy people watching or enjoying a great meal at one of the many restaurants.

649963693.name: Great people watching and some good shopping for tourists
649963693.author: a TripAdvisor user
649963693.reviewBody: They have done a great job with this ocean front malecon.  Wide sidewalks, some good eats, friendly locals and lots of shopping and crafts.  Cruise ship days get busy, but if you like to just watch people it can be fun.  Grab a massage, grab a beer, barter a bit for your favorite items.

645805891.name: Clean beach front, lots to do
645805891.author: a TripAdvisor user
645805891.reviewBody: The Malec\u00f3n in Progreso is a must do day activity. On days when the cruise ships come in, there are several markets open for lots of shopping and souvenirs. There are plenty of beach front restaurants to choose from, several of which offer service on the beach. Most of very reasonable to eat at. During cruise days, most will allow you to pay in USD, but they all will accept Mexican Pesos. When there is no cruise ship, there are many less stores and street vendors open, but usually they are willing to give you a better deal. You can find everything you are looking for. There is also the Progreso sign, which is a great picture opportunity.

645779771.name: Nice place to walk and enjoy the beach
645779771.author: a TripAdvisor user
645779771.reviewBody: Nice wide sidewalk for stroll or bike. On one side many restaurants an, convenience stores and miscellaneous ones. There is always a lovely breeze blowing here. The beach is very big with relatively fine sand. water and air temperature pretty much the same. The water is shallow for quite some distance. You can sit at cafe tables and get drinks and food on the beach. \nAlternatively you can rent loungers on the beach or just sit on the beach if you prefer. It is relatively quiet on the beach Monday through Friday then picks up on the weekend especially Sundays. If on any day a cruise ship comes in it gets busy. To get to Progreso from Merida you can take the autoprogreso bus service which terminates about four blocks from the beach. If you want to drive there it is an easy drive on a multi lane toll free highway.

640010993.name: Mexican version of an American Boardwalk
640010993.author: a TripAdvisor user
640010993.reviewBody:
The Malecon is set along the beach in Progreso. It us about 30 short blocks long so it is easy to walk in a short amount of time. It is hard surfaced concrete. 
It begins near the pier at Calle (Street) 80 and consists of restaurants, bars, motels, vendors, & shops.
Walking by the shops, stores, and restaurants can sometimes feel like running the gauntlet but a simple "no gracias" will work to be left alone. 
It is very safe and is patrolled by the police often. There are a couple of high priced nice restaurants that I think are over rated and I believe you are paying for the atmosphere rather than the quality of the food.
My favorite place is THE MILK BAR which is owned by an American named Charlie who is a great guy. The food is absolutely the very best and the prices are reasonable. The menu has everything from burgers & fries to authentic Mexican dishes. It does sell milkshakes, smoothies, and fresh fruit drinks as well as beer & alcoholic drinks.

672247047.name: Sisters Time!!
672247047.author: a TripAdvisor user
672247047.reviewBody: I came here with my sister in March and just came back las sunday, if you want to pass an excellent day at the beach this is the place. Great place, Great food and Jose & Piedad amazing people!!! Every tume I think in going to the beach I thought in Luna Lunera.

666061694.name: Secluded serenity!
666061694.author: a TripAdvisor user
666061694.reviewBody: So peaceful and beautiful!  Family of 8 (ages 23-54) spent the day and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. They also provide free transportation from the Progresso shuttle/bus station. Jose was a most gracious host and Santos was very attentive. Facilities are clean. Enjoyed the hammocks on the beach. Best guacamole ever!  Our meal was nice and portions generous.

664344819.name: Wonderful stay
664344819.author: a TripAdvisor user
664344819.reviewBody: We met a few great couples from our cruise ship headed here as well.  The trip started off rough because we couldn\u2019t locate the driver or exact location.  The locals were giving us all wrong information.  However, once we arrived it was a delightful stay with great food and service.

663566754.name: Great day
663566754.author: a TripAdvisor user
663566754.reviewBody: We came for the day with a family. Beautiful location. Great customer service. Good food. Wonderful wonderful time.

663322183.name: A little piece of Heaven!
663322183.author: a TripAdvisor user
663322183.reviewBody: Looking for a small group beach getaway.. this is the place . The staff and owner Petey is so accommodating the food excellent. Plenty of snacks fresh guacamole. Fresh coconut pie Cold drinks a swim up bar .. just a few steps to the beach. Massage was excellent at a cheap price . They treat you just like family! Would love to go back . If you end up at the marketplace don\u2019t let the vendors try to talk you out of Going... the place is Marvelous!!

663093134.name: Looking for something quiet yet great in Progresso? \r\nThis is the real deal!
663093134.author: a TripAdvisor user
663093134.reviewBody: Just traveled on a Royal Caribbean ship and one of the ports was Progresso. We chose to spend the time we had at Luna Lunera. \n$40 per person - private beach, private pool, adult beverages, water and soda.  They also provide fresh pico, guacamole and other snacks. Total legit food!! Then, the owner prepares lunch for you. Several different items to chose from, some substitutions were allowed. The food and place are AMAZING. It is very private, quiet and quaint. Kid friendly as well. Limited to 20 people per day so, if you don\u2019t have a large group, you may be sharing the place with others. They have shady places as well as full sun and a very relaxing set up for an outdoor massage. I highly recommend Luna Lunera. They treat you very good and wait on you hand and foot. The massage is $8 for half hour and $16 for an hour. We paid $20 (very relaxing and worth it) and please make sure you leave a tip. Very good option for Progresso. \u2764\ufe0f\n-An\u2019drea (Pearland, TX)

659623831.name: 10/10 recommend
659623831.author: a TripAdvisor user
659623831.reviewBody: I stopped here while on a Carnival Cruise and most people were going to a Corona Beach Party. This is more intimate, beautiful and happy than that place could ever be!! Recommend for families, girls trips (like mine!) and also couples. \n\nCan only pay in cash (USD accepted), so make sure to bring cash! Very easy to get to from the port with clear instructions. Cannot day enough that this is a must-do in Progreso.

659623697.name: Great hosts and lots of fun!
659623697.author: a TripAdvisor user
659623697.reviewBody: This was a great place for my friends and I to go after we got off the cruise boat. Transportation was on time and the experience as a whole was very affordable. You get drinks, snacks and GREAT food!

658860290.name: Relaxing and refreshing. Fantastic!
658860290.author: a TripAdvisor user
658860290.reviewBody: My friends and I really loved this place! There is a beautiful pool, there are steps leading down to a private part of beach, and dotted around are hammocks and deck chairs for your use. They gave us a great plate of snacks as soon as we arrived and then a delicious three course meal for lunch. There were free refills of fresh juice drinks, and we had a coolbox that we could put alcohol we brought with us in. All for 500 pesos! A wonderful day, would highly recommend.

658809390.name: Beautiful place, excellent service, amazing people and delicious food.
658809390.author: a TripAdvisor user
658809390.reviewBody: We spend all day in the luna lunera beach garden and was amazing, they have a private beach where the sea is like a pool.\n\nWe took the best decision going over there

655509710.name: Relaxing day at mini resort
655509710.author: a TripAdvisor user
655509710.reviewBody: Privately owned by local couple. Hosts local or cruise guests at their beachfront property with private pool and cabanas that includes lunch, snacks, and drinks for a reasonable price.  The host limits the number of guest to under 20 providing a quiet day and relaxing day at the beach. Host provides transportation from Progreso bus terminal which is just outside venue that Carnival drops off guests after boarding free shuttle from port.  Meals and snacks were homemade and hosts were flexible to accommodate special diets.  Great value and enjoyable day.  Will definitely come again if we find ourselves in Progreso in the future.

642916499.name: What a Awesome Day.
642916499.author: a TripAdvisor user
642916499.reviewBody: My Husband and i were Meet at the bus stop. I like that they emailed me pictures of who was going to pick us up. There was a nice pool they had some pool floats. The beach was nice. They served a snacks, Lunch, desserts, drinks all was very good. The lobster bisque had big chunks of lobster so yummy. We will go back when we get to town again. Highly recommended to go.

639762968.name: Hidden Gem
639762968.author: a TripAdvisor user
639762968.reviewBody: Welcome to the hidden gem in Progreso. If you want to be pampered and taken care of for a few hours and not have to pay big $$$ at a resort this is the place to go. You are treated great all day from the free transportation pick up and return, to the wonderful service all the time your there. We were treated to lovely snacks and a beautiful lunch as well as drinks by the pool without the crush of other tourists. It\u2019s like having a house on the beach in Progreso for the day at a much lower cost. Everything was perfect. Progreso doesn\u2019t offer a lot to do as a tourist but this hidden gem is one to try if you stop in Progreso.

638993685.name: An oasis
638993685.author: a TripAdvisor user
638993685.reviewBody: We had a wonderful day at Luna Lunera. The property was beautiful. We were escorted to our cabana and served lemonade and ice tea. From there we just wandered back and forth from the cabana to the beach, stopping at the pool. We were served an amazing lunch of very fresh fish and veggies - a menu that was adapted to our food "stuff". We had a wonderful day and will go back.\n

637529649.name: Luna Lunera Beach Club
637529649.author: a TripAdvisor user
637529649.reviewBody: One of the best deals in Mexico! If your cruise ship stops in Progresso Mexico I highly recommend spending the day at Luna Lunera. It is a very private intimate beach facility right on the ocean and it also has a beautiful refreshing pool. The hostess Pieadad certainly has the gift of hospitality and she is a wonderful cook. We had a tray of delicious snacks, drinks, and a three course gourmet meal with dessert. Transportation was also provided.

631708314.name: Perfect Beach, Food and Nice People
631708314.author: a TripAdvisor user
631708314.reviewBody: I went there for a beach day, whiile i was in a cruise. I can say that beach is so beautiful, the colors, sand and of course very sunny area \ud83d\ude0a. The pool is very nice & interesting, the food that they offered was delicious and Pieda i think is her name was great, trying to make me feel confortable, happy and with everything that i need.\nI can recommend this place for families, couples and for solo travelers like me.\nI\u2019ll go back to stay some days... will be a dream!!!

617817142.name: 10/10 worth your while!
617817142.author: a TripAdvisor user
617817142.reviewBody: My husband and I were looking for something to do near the cruise port, when we noticed that Luna Lunera was only 10 mins away from the port, we decided to check it out. Our overall experience was amazing! We spent the morning relaxing on the private beach (which was much needed after spending time on a crowded cruise ship.) after enjoying the beach we went to eat lunch (which was delicious!) and lounge by the beautiful pool. The lunch menu offered a great variety of things, so there\u2019s something for everyone to enjoy and most importantly, the quality of the food was top notch. The service was exceptional as well! The attention to detail is remarkable and everything ran so smoothly that it felt like we were the only guests on the property. A major plus is being so close to the port. This allowed us to really enjoy our day and not feel rushed to get back to the port on time. If we\u2019re ever in the area again, we would definitely come here again!  I highly recommend Luna Lunera!

616552469.name: Beach, Sun & RELAXING!!
616552469.author: a TripAdvisor user
616552469.reviewBody: Excellent place to go to the beach in a quiet, high quality place. Delicious food and great service. \n\nTotally recommend it!

616342757.name: A PERFECT BEACH DAY!...
616342757.author: a TripAdvisor user
616342757.reviewBody: ...looking for a nice relaxing day?...go to Luna Lunera, beautiful beach with a private pool and cabana and delicious food and beverages! (I recovered my energy at that paradise to continue with my busy cruise schedule). The place, the food and the service: high quality, definitely to enjoy!

616297282.name: Relax, privacy, professionalism and kindness
616297282.author: a TripAdvisor user
616297282.reviewBody: Is the perfect place to relax yourself, with a unique and warm privacy. You are treated with professionalism and kindness, you are in the best hands, beautiful customer service and delicious food\u2019s and beverages \u2018 options. You are surrounded with the most beautiful beach, is like to be at heaven. We recommend this place 400%, you will not make a mistake for sure.

595932319.name: Great place for private catered parties
595932319.author: a TripAdvisor user
595932319.reviewBody: Went to a friends birthday party.  The place is awesome.  Water view from everywhere.  Beachfront venue.   Very fancy elite place settings.   Great service.  Very nice pool right by dining area.  Place is beautiful.  I see why people like to use it for weddings.

583471056.name: Beach day pass
583471056.author: a TripAdvisor user
583471056.reviewBody: You have all what you need to spend a day at the beach in a nice, clean location and very private location. Quality food.

570876561.name: wedding venue
570876561.author: a TripAdvisor user
570876561.reviewBody:
This venue is a beautiful setting for a destination wedding !....Ceremony was on the beach and was really highlighted by the lapping of the waves, emphasizing the vows of marriage !!
Piadad, the owner, did a wonderful job, made beautiful floral arrangements, to ensuring everything ran smoothly.
It is a more intimate setting than having at an all inclusive resort.
I was a guest at this wedding, and highly recommend it.

668142702.name: El Corchito
668142702.author: a TripAdvisor user
668142702.reviewBody: This is a local ecological park in Progreso.  You have to go there by boat because it is about 50 yards south of the bypass that runs behind Progreso toward the beaches east of Progreso.  The government bought it or took control of it a few years ago.  They invested in it and made lots of improvements.  I have known one of the founders for many years, who still works there.  There are several cenotes or fresh water springs there to see and swim in if you like.  They dug them out and protected a few so that the brackish water of the ceniga/swamp doesn\u2019t get in to the swimming area. Nice and clear fresh water is in the largest natural pool of water.  It is shady and has trails through the mangroves.  There are some rustic wooden buildings to protect one from the rain or sunlight or hang a hammock.  There are some raccoons and coti mundis that live there and they will sometimes approach looking for a handout of something to eat.  It is an interesting natural place full of life and how things were before people and the modern world changed things, in old Yucatan.  You can pack up a lunch and snacks to take across when you go.  It is open daylight only.  It is definitely worth seeing and really isn\u2019t that expensive.  Sometimes you can see flamingos there wading and feeding or flying overhead.  I have seen flights of flamingos that had over 1000 birds flying in a winding trail in the air that continued for about an hour.  Usually they are in smaller groups up the beach around observation tower in Huaymitun or toward the highway that comes in to Progreso from Merida.  The early morning or late afternoon is the best time to see flamingos.

666066278.name: Small but refreshing and a nice day trip
666066278.author: a TripAdvisor user
666066278.reviewBody: We had some friends visit us at Casa Amigoville BNB in Chelem and we all decided to take the trip to see the cenote and it was important to see one you could swim in.  These pools are very nice clean and it was not too busy when we went.  A short drive from Chelem and a 5 minute boat ride through the ria to the site.  Very inexpensive and a great trip.

664572501.name: Nice neat cenotes with hammocks
664572501.author: a TripAdvisor user
664572501.reviewBody: We only arrived for a few minutes towards the end of the day. There were some people still swimming in the cenotes. I don\'t really know how it would look crowded but I liked it. We were checked upon riding the short boat ride and couldn\'t take gum or sunblock so we had to leave it with our driver.\nThe place is shaded and has a few different cenotes but probably only one or two are for swimming. It is well fix and they rent hammocks and other things.

655087289.name: Waist of time and money
655087289.author: a TripAdvisor user
655087289.reviewBody: Don\'t waist your time on this place. First off they raise the prices from 35 pesos to 90 pesos if it\'s a cruise ship day, it\'s not a lot of money but dishonest as far as I\'m concerned, especially if your not part of the cruise ship.  Also there really isn\'t much to see, just mangroves.  The cenetos are small and the only one to swim in, the water is not clear and has a soft bottom so unless you are the first people there expect dirty water.

654576640.name: Ugly mangrove and cenotes
654576640.author: a TripAdvisor user
654576640.reviewBody: A local recommended visiting the site because it have not only the mangrove but also 3 cenotes to swim.  \nThe mangrove is ugly, doesn\u2019t have many animals and the cenotes are really disappointing. \nDon\u2019t recommend at all.

652114288.name: Not on cruiseship day
652114288.author: a TripAdvisor user
652114288.reviewBody: This is a nice place to see for 35 pesos, however, on cruiseship days they Jack it up to 90 pesos pp. When I said how was it 35 last week and 90 now, she says those are the new prices. Very dishonest.

641876090.name: Four adults
641876090.author: a TripAdvisor user
641876090.reviewBody: The park only has raccoons and a few coatimundis. The cenotes were small and not clear like in other places. We had to wait in long lines to get on the small boats that take you back and forth. Maybe more fun for young children.

638327671.name: Beauty surrounds you!
638327671.author: a TripAdvisor user
638327671.reviewBody: Crystal clear water. Raccoons galore! I saw 2 babies with their mom. Short boat ride across the river to the cenotes. Look for the termite beds in the trees. Some are quite large. You will see a few cork trees. The area is safe. Restrooms for changing into and out of your swimsuits. There are floaties for sale and some souvenirs.

635874840.name: Beautiful
635874840.author: a TripAdvisor user
635874840.reviewBody: Lovely place to visit lots of raccoons and coatis lovely cenotes and a great boat ride won\u2019t take u longer than an hour and remember your swim stuff

632992559.name: Pleasant stroll through protected mangroves
632992559.author: a TripAdvisor user
632992559.reviewBody:
El Corchito is not a spectacular UNESCO protected site. It is however a nice visit to a protected mangrove. Including the short boat ride across to it from the roadway, it should not take more than an hour or so.

Take your swimsuit along for a cooling dip in the pools (not true cenotes).

To protect the animals and environment NO food or chemical sprays are allowed. 

Get there early to avoid the crowds from Merida and/or from the cruise ships that dock every few days.

625570841.name: Refreshing break
625570841.author: a TripAdvisor user
625570841.reviewBody: Spent a couple of hours at Conchita and liked it. It is rustic with paths thru the mangrove forest to 3 cenotes. The last one the largest and most inviting about 5-6 ft deep and filled with clear, cool water and a gravel bottom. Wonderful on a hot day and not very buggy.

617272503.name: WASTE of time!
617272503.author: a TripAdvisor user
617272503.reviewBody: This place is terrible. The entrance fee is MXN $35 or so (around USD $2). You will take a short boat ride to the "cenotes." There are 3 cenotes in total, 2 of them are tiny and 1 of them is 5-6ft deep. There are TONS of mosquitos. The only cool thing about this place is watching the raccoons and Coatis. Go somewhere else!

595082288.name: Interesting, unique, and a good value
595082288.author: a TripAdvisor user
595082288.reviewBody: I was describe this reserve as pleasant, quaint, interesting and a good value. This is not a fancy operation at all, and its not a big place. You can pretty much absorb the experience in an hour or so. A short boat ride across the lagoon to a freshwater cut into the mangrove and cork forest. Some small cenotes you can swim in if you wish. See some fish, raccoons, and maybe a caiman.  At 35 pesos per person, its a good value and a nice short diversion. I imagine it could get crowded on weekends but our weekday trip was very enjoyable. You are not allowed to take food in there and they will check your baggage to make sure you don\'t have substances that could harm the water or vegetation. Don\'t forget to use insect repellent. The mosquitoes weren\'t really bad during our visit but there were some.

584214466.name: OK but not a must do!!
584214466.author: a TripAdvisor user
584214466.reviewBody: This was part of our Progresso tour with Sergio Tours. You enter the park by boat through the mangroves. The park was interesting with lots of wildlife. You can feed the raccoons and coatis tortillas. There is a small pool filled with "doctor fish" so you can have a foot pedicure. The fish eat the dead skin off your feet. The water was cold, so we did not swim. We stayed 30 minutes, and then went on with our tour. The park is ok but not a must do while in Progresso.

579351792.name: It\'s OK but not great
579351792.author: a TripAdvisor user
579351792.reviewBody:
What makes this place is the raccoons and other animals but having said that there were just the odd bird, one small turtle and several fish.

The cenotes aren't special and look like they were "dug" out of the mangroves. Plus the most plentiful thing there is mosquitoes, hundreds of them, so bring repellent.

Went there as part of a Pelicans/Mangroves full day tour from La Jarana Tours, so was OK in the overall context but wouldn't make a special trip.

Note they don't allow you to take food over to the mangroves and will check your bags etc so don't bring any.

579296693.name: efinitely a place to go if you are in or close to Progreso
579296693.author: a TripAdvisor user
579296693.reviewBody: Is a set of small cenotes or "ojos de agua" in the middle of the mangrove area. There are a lot of birds, racoons, colorful fishes and pizotes.

578345264.name: meet the locals
578345264.author: a TripAdvisor user
578345264.reviewBody: A great way to get close to some of the local wildlife. yes they may be habituated but they appear to come and go as they please. The guides know their stuff and do seem to be committed to keeping the site from becoming too much like a petting zoo.\nI liked it!

577191099.name: Must do!
577191099.author: a TripAdvisor user
577191099.reviewBody:
Very nice place to go if you are around Progreso and you like to swim in "cenote".
This place is very cheap (35 pesos) and you can spend a lot of time there. We stay around 3 hours.
You can even put your feet on water with "doctor fishes" (small fishes that eat dead skin). Something that is expensive in many tourism areas and there it's free! :)
We stayed in an hotel in the city and we walk there. Just before we arrive, we saw city bus with the name "El Corchito" on it. So we assume, that this bus travel to this place, then it's reachable in bus.

574607520.name: Cute and fun
574607520.author: a TripAdvisor user
574607520.reviewBody: Our family loved this tour! The raccoons are the cutest little animals. The cenotes were beautiful and refreshing. We chose a day to go while the local children were still in school so it was not very busy, on the weekends this place is so busy.\nEverything was very clean, the staff working here do a wonderful job. Highly recommend and we will be back next year!

570970546.name: Hidden treasure
570970546.author: a TripAdvisor user
570970546.reviewBody: This place was recommended to us by a random person we met at playa Progreso, we wanted to escape from that crowded noisy place and El Corchito was perfect for it. You pay a small fee for the boat to get you across. You can bathe in 3 of 4 cenotes, observe raccoons and turtles, or simply take a walk along the mangrove canal. You cannot take food with you and there is no restaurant, this is to protect the animals.

567850815.name: You just have to go!
567850815.author: a TripAdvisor user
567850815.reviewBody:
Words can't truly capture or summarize what you'll get from 'El Corchito' bio-reserve, so you truly do just have to go.
Pelicans, raccoons, perhaps a boa constrictor or small crocodile.
It starts with a river crossing from the clean, welcoming info. centre, then you hop out at the grounds and stroll along the paths, taking in what this odd little pocket of nature has to offer.
Bring your swimsuit as there are three clear, clean cenotes good for swimming!

562811111.name: Perfect for our Young Family
562811111.author: a TripAdvisor user
562811111.reviewBody: We loved El Corchito! My kids were impressed with the wild-ish animals and loved swimming and walking on the paths, but their favorite part was getting a fish pedicure in a crystal-clear pool of water. We stayed for an hour and a half and wished we didn\'t have to rush off. We didn\'t have time to see everything. The biggest pool wasn\'t as murky as many online pictures make it seem. We could see the bottom, but swimmers do kick up sediment. 35 pesos for adults, 20 for kids, under five free. We spent a little extra to rent floaties.\n\nGetting There: We took a local bus from the Bus loop at Calles 29 & 82. We asked around for it, but no one seemed to know about the bus until we we reached the bus station. It was 7 pesos per adult, a 20 minute ride (last stop at Calles 39 & 46), and a short three block walk to El Corchito (Plus ice cold coconut milk at a stand on the way!). When we were leaving, a taxi pulled in dropping someone else off, and we caught a ride back to El Centro for 50 pesos. We could have taken the bus back, though, we were told it comes every 10-20 minutes. We never felt unsafe; the bus and streets mostly had women and children on them. Everyone we asked for help was very  friendly and willing.

560204787.name: A complete waste of time
560204787.author: a TripAdvisor user
560204787.reviewBody: Went here believing from Lonely Planet that this was a nature reserve. In fact it is a small park with some animals and a few  chenotes ( freshwater swimming holes) of dubious cleanliness . One is carried over the  creek from the  entrance to the park. There is a limited system of paths between the swimming holes which takes about15 min to walk round. Ther re a few habituated recoons, coatis and pelicans. i.e. not wild . As   the place is grossly overcrowded by humans it is hardly surprising that thwre are veryfew wild animals or birds to see. My count was 1 oriole!! It only costs pennies to get in though. No picnicking allowed. If you are a nature lover  AVOID a complete wste of time. Even the observation tower was closed.

559628756.name: Nice spot in Progreso
559628756.author: a TripAdvisor user
559628756.reviewBody: We stopped here for a few hours to check out the cenotes.  There are a lot of them here.  Unfortunately for the Reserve, we had already been to another cenote earlier in the day at the site of some ruins and it was beautiful and clear.  It was also our first one ever.  So we weren\'t as much of a fan of theses cenotes because they are green and not clear at all.  The nice thing is that some of the cenotes are very shallow, as in a couple of feet deep, so that is nice for younger kids.  While here, you will also see many raccoons that will come up to meet you, hoping for food.  The Reserve no longer allows visitors to bring in food to feed the animals and they will check your bags as you board the small boat that takes you to the cenotes.  Definitely not a bad stop and especially good because of its proximity to Progreso, so it makes an excellent excursion from a cruise ship.

559254636.name: We came to the eco-park as a stop on Sergio\'s Tours
559254636.author: a TripAdvisor user
559254636.reviewBody: You boat across a small lake and into a channel cut into the mangroves. There are raccoons, pelicans, alligators, lots of fish you can see in crystal clear water and even a place where you can put your feet into the water and let the small fish nibble on the dead skin. The trails are easy to walk and shady. Our tour guide, Uvaldo, did a great job explaining features in the park. It\'s a very interesting place, I would like to go back again. If there were only one site you could see in Progresso I would recommend it be this one. The caretakers, many of whom developed the park are to be commended.

557715722.name: Hidden gem
557715722.author: a TripAdvisor user
557715722.reviewBody: Less is more and it\u2019s greater than the sum of its parts. The cenotes, pathways and dense mangrove forest are very tranquil and quiet. Well worth a visit.

556576390.name: Nice visit
556576390.author: a TripAdvisor user
556576390.reviewBody:
We have spent a lot of time in the Progreso area but have never been to El Corchito before. This was a nice spot to spend 1-2 hours. 

From the main entrance (where you buy tickets) you then take a boat across the water to the other side. The boat was clean and there were life jackets available. On the other side are walking trails, cenotes and wildlife (particularly raccoons and another type of raccoon-type animal - see photo). 

The animals are quite tame. We didn’t feed them but staff there did which provided an opportunity to get close. However the raccoons can get a bit aggressive between themselves while eating - so it’s best not to get too close (but a zoom lens helps!).

546504888.name: Wonderful place to spend a cool afternoon
546504888.author: a TripAdvisor user
546504888.reviewBody: We went to El corchito twice during our stay in the area. it\'s a quiet attraction that was just perfect for our young kids. there is a short boat ride into the mangroves then some wildlife to see, cenotes to visit and fish to swim with. it is shady and when we were there was nice and quiet. It\'s a great relaxing way to spend a few hours!\nA note for travellers: you cannot bring any food across. If you wish to have a picnic plan to eat before you cross over to the park. there are lovely shaded picnic tables there.

545344352.name: Centoes
545344352.author: a TripAdvisor user
545344352.reviewBody: Cenotes close to Progreso. Raccoons puts on a show. Grab your bathing suit, towels and camera and go explore.

542309316.name: Like going back in time
542309316.author: a TripAdvisor user
542309316.reviewBody: It was absolutely amazing! We were in awe! If not for Jose Sanchez with Criss & Sands Tour & Travel Mexico, we would not have seen it , let alone, experienced it first hand.

539435818.name: Fun day!
539435818.author: a TripAdvisor user
539435818.reviewBody: This is a great little eco park where you can see local flora and fauna, swim in a cenote, have a picnic lunch as well as enjoying 2 short boat trips. (there and back)

538910623.name: Coons
538910623.author: a TripAdvisor user
538910623.reviewBody: The place was amazing. The coons come right up to the boat when you come in. The natural springs are beautiful.

518806105.name: A cool place to cool off
518806105.author: a TripAdvisor user
518806105.reviewBody: We went here as part of a tour. It was a nice escape from the heat. Not as beautiful as other cenotes in the area, but there is a lot of cool wildlife like alligators etc. we had a fun time

508541627.name: Interesting venue  - Loved the break from the beach
508541627.author: a TripAdvisor user
508541627.reviewBody: On a hot afternoon, nothing better than cooling off among the mangroves,  quiet and tranquil location  - Love the wildlife too.. Educational -

498002620.name: Beautiful place
498002620.author: a TripAdvisor user
498002620.reviewBody: Was in Progreso on a cruise and came here with a private tour company. It was beautiful the staff was friendly. Loved all the animals

497764849.name: Nice Stop
497764849.author: a TripAdvisor user
497764849.reviewBody: We stopped here in the afternoon after spending some time at the beach in Progreso.  We enjoyed the different cenotes (not the best that we visited, but they were nice).  They have varying depths, so people of all heights can enjoy.  There are inflatables for rent at the larger, deeper cenote.  The animals were fun to watch.  The coati and raccoons run around the place, and we also saw a basilisk lizard and a few birds.  We also saw some flamingos as we drove down the road leaving the place.

488900252.name: A short cool place to explore.
488900252.author: a TripAdvisor user
488900252.reviewBody: Went last week.  The tour guide was knowledgeable.  The waiting area and bathrooms very clean.  The sink holes were cool and clean.

485347250.name: keep down your expectations
485347250.author: a TripAdvisor user
485347250.reviewBody: it\'s a magnificent place to rest and have al little walk. The boatride is fun and they have kept the place in the best conditions. However, the cenotes are quite small ( in the blueprints, they look bigger) so you will have no much space to enjoy the swimming, but the views and the interaction with birds and other kind of animals is a show that may worth it.

483455233.name: Awesome little piece of paradise
483455233.author: a TripAdvisor user
483455233.reviewBody: Small, well kept park. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We saw coatis, raccoons, several types of birds and fish. We swam in the cenote and had a great time.

478262451.name: Interesting
478262451.author: a TripAdvisor user
478262451.reviewBody: We found this place quite by accident and for 35 pesos per person it was worth the price. We did not know what to expect and found it charming a fun outing. I think what we enjoyed the most was the one gentleman who took time to teach us about the different trees and their names. The Cenote was nothing amazing like some of the more expensive and famous ones. It was more a pool of fresh water. We were surprised to see a couple resident raccoons as we did not think they were native to the area and two other creatures that I am sad to say I don\'t remember their names were quite fun to watch. Large nests of termites littered the trees - the trees by the way were incredible and had seen ones like those in the jungles of Australia.

476976988.name: Don\'t expect too much and you\'ll like it
476976988.author: a TripAdvisor user
476976988.reviewBody: El Curchito makes a good two or three hours trip if you grow tired of the well developed beach and malecon in Progreso. It\'s basically three little swimming holes, only one of them really suitable for more than two swimming strokes. Yet the setting is beautiful, and the two minute boatride crossing the lagoon is fun. Oh yes, and there\'s a bunch of raccoons, watch your stuff!

472782439.name: Weekend with the family
472782439.author: a TripAdvisor user
472782439.reviewBody: When you visit El Corchito you will see local families spending their weekend in this natural place! Is cheap near from M\u00e9rida City and you can spend there a coupke of hours.\nIs better if you go in weekdays.

470139908.name: If you want cenotes, this is not the place.  If you want mangroves, do it.
470139908.author: a TripAdvisor user
470139908.reviewBody:
This is a really cool place to go to see inside a mangrove but the place is small and you won't spend much time here.  The cenotes are crowded and cloudy and I am adventurous but I had zero desire to go swimming here.  I walked around the whole place taking pictures for about 30 minutes and then I headed back to the shore.  The one cenote that looked perfect to swim in was "No Swimming."  It is a good way to spend an hour if you are looking for something to do and want to see some cool nature.

* You cannot take food here.  The local animals (raccoons, etc) will take your bag into the mangrove and you will never see it again!  My friends saw this happen.  No booze is allowed either.

** I walked here from the main road leading into Progreso from Merida.  I got off the bus from Merida at the Bodega Aurerra and walked about 25 minutes along the highway to this place.  The sidewalks are in excellent shape, but it is deserted and very industrial.  I would not recommend walking alone but if you are in a group, go for it!  Do not walk here in the dark as there is no lighting and it is very deserted.

*** When I was done, I walked two/three blocks north from the glorieta (round-about) in front of El Corchito.  I walked to get a pesero (small bus) back to the centro to visit the malecon (boardwalk).  It is totally sketchy, and I walked by a deserted field, a group of men throwing industrial trash into the bush illegally, and a dead dog.  This is not for the faint-of-heart tourist but if you are with friends or know Mexico, go for it.  At the Agua Purificada place (on the right), you go a little farther ahead (10-20 meters) and turn left and the pesero is there (parked) or will arrive there.  It is 8 pesos back to the centre.

467912513.name: A Memorable Experience
467912513.author: a TripAdvisor user
467912513.reviewBody: You get to go on to a boat and it takes you across a lake to an Island. We got to see many different forms of wild life, swim in a Cenote and dip our feet in to a pool where little fish come up and suck your toes. This was a very interesting experience. \nMy only complaint was the washrooms on the island were dirty and the toilet does not flush so we had to pee on top of someone else\'s pee.  \n

462370168.name: A lovey surprise in Progreso, a nice spring in the middle of the mangroves.
462370168.author: a TripAdvisor user
462370168.reviewBody: A wonderfiul surprise in Progreso, a nice spring in the middle of the mangroves . There are 4 cristal clear water pool amongs the mangroves and wildlife.

460753774.name: Must see if you are in the area
460753774.author: a TripAdvisor user
460753774.reviewBody: Lovely place, extremely well kept and very friendly staff. You can walk around and spend some time swimming in the cenotes. One of the cenotes has turtles! They have WIFI in the entrance and very clean bathrooms.

450854017.name: LOVELY!
450854017.author: a TripAdvisor user
450854017.reviewBody: We were taken here by Sergio\'s Tours.  It is a beautiful and quiet little park.  There are turtles and fish in the cenote that swim with you. The little boys we had with us absolutely loved it! There are a few different cenotes at the park.  The walk back to El Corchito was just breathtaking.

444659916.name: Little jungle
444659916.author: a TripAdvisor user
444659916.reviewBody: Nice spot to see. A variety of pools of varying depths to experience. Wildlife with fish in the streams. Good for a couple of hours with lots of shade. A local sight worth seeing. A good walk from downtown,bus ride or taxi. Small entrance fee and accessible washrooms before you cross the canal.

441214639.name: Lots of birds and some interesting animals
441214639.author: a TripAdvisor user
441214639.reviewBody: This is a place visited by locals.  It\'s nothing fancy but it\'s a nice place to relax.  The animal life loves to steal food from knapsacks so be warned.  Lots of great birds if you\'re into birdwatching.

417696521.name: very relaxing
417696521.author: a TripAdvisor user
417696521.reviewBody: Very nice natural waterpark so to speak. After a short calm boat ride you arrive on an island with 4 cenotes to swim in and even with large family units everyone respected the peaceful ambiance. Such as kids just swam and had fun with their families no running screaming and acting like savages just nice kids. Animals are abundant and friendly and the natives are making fish nets, etc right there but no pressure to buy or hawk one to you. Great photos and very clean-would go again.

411740046.name: Local secret
411740046.author: a TripAdvisor user
411740046.reviewBody: El corchito is the result of a community pulling together to deliver a great experiance for locals and visitors.It is a great way to spen a few hours or all day.\nThe short boat ride is fun, the swimming is the cristal water of fhe cenote in the middle of the mangroves is a deligth. Bring your food or buyt it there, take a nap in a hamaca.

354206222.name: Cenote with awful smell
354206222.author: a TripAdvisor user
354206222.reviewBody: Unfortunately, we were maybe unlucky but it seems that men were taking out mud from the channels used to get to the site. The smell was like rotten eggs, and both my husband and I had nausea for a few hours after.  \nFortunately at the last cenote the smell was tolerable and we could swim. So we spent 1 hour instead of the 3 hours planned.\nBut I read a lot of good comments so it might have been just a bad luck.

351972232.name: Not what it appears to be.
351972232.author: a TripAdvisor user
351972232.reviewBody: Showed up expecting miles of trails and wildlife to enjoy but really it\'s just an area for picnickers and families \nto enjoy 4 fresh water pools. The wildlife consisted of raccoons and birds. Skip this one if your looking for more.

349962295.name: Hidden Gem
349962295.author: a TripAdvisor user
349962295.reviewBody: El Corchito was a great little adventure from Merida. We found the place relaxing and interesting with the pools to swim in or walk around the mangroves looking for wildlife, with not many tourists around. We took the Progresso bus from Merida old town for 35 peso return, each. Once in Progreso we decided to walk to the reserve which took about 40-45 minutes, although you could take a taxi which wouldn\'t cost much. Entry for us was 35 peso each, which seems different to what others have paid but that could depend on when you visit, but either way it\'s a bargain. We spent about 3 hours there and loved it.

347007485.name: fabulous reserve
347007485.author: a TripAdvisor user
347007485.reviewBody: this was terrific and so reasonable.....25 peso each.  you take a long boat ride acrioss the bay to a jungle reserve full of birds and small cenotes to swim in.  the walkways are wonderful to stroll in and lead to several spots of interest.  even little racoons to feed.

344838292.name: Hidden Treasure
344838292.author: a TripAdvisor user
344838292.reviewBody: We spent a couple of hours exploring this hidden treasure. Well worth the price of admission! Would visit again if we are in this area.

342434178.name: Great place for a picnic
342434178.author: a TripAdvisor user
342434178.reviewBody: El Corchito is a series of clear, fresh water ponds in the marshes just south of Progreso.  It\'s a great place for a cool swim and a picnic if you avoid the crowds on weekends and holidays.  No alcohol allowed and they search your bags.  The entry is $30 pesos and covers the short ferry ride there and back.  This area is a clean, largely mosquito free place for the family, thanks to the few fishermen who have built it and cared for it for years.  It\'s easily and cheaply accessible by bicycle, taxi or car from Progreso and you might even get to feed a wild raccoon or see a snake swimming across the pools.  We did.

338579782.name: Nice afternoon out
338579782.author: a TripAdvisor user
338579782.reviewBody: Worth the trip if you have some spare time in Merida or Progresso. We had a car so it was very easy to get to, you park just outside progresso and the boats run you across the water pretty much when you want. Entry costs 35 pesos which includes the return (v short) boat trip. I\'m not sure if the cenotes are natural or man made but they are ok to swim in if a bit murky. There are loads of raccoons which are very entertaining to watch as they try to steal people\'s lunch! We also saw egrets and a kingfisher. If you don\'t have time to see mangroves anywhere else it\'s a good opportunity, but it is definitely a park with clear paths and no smoking signs everywhere so not the most natural experience. Don\'t go out of your way to go there but if you\'re in Progresso anyway it\'s a nice way to spend a few hours.

283732087.name: Nice natural park
283732087.author: a TripAdvisor user
283732087.reviewBody: Nice natural park with natural pools and tons of vegetation. If you get lucky you might see some wild life around, make sure to take your food and drinks as there is not much to buy there.

270004585.name: Shady Tropical Oasis
270004585.author: a TripAdvisor user
270004585.reviewBody: Absolutely love this little place. Wild life abound and it is so cool and beautiful. Take a picnic and stay a while.

268696628.name: Totally new entry and parking,  but map location is wrong
268696628.author: a TripAdvisor user
268696628.reviewBody: \nThe government put some serious moneyinto upgrading the parking area and support buildings, so El Corchito is no longer just a wide spot in the road.\nBut the map on the Overview page is incorrect.  El Corchito is on HIGHWAY 27 (the bypass around Progreso) not CALLE 27 (which is in town).  From the beach just drive straight south on Calle 46, cross the divided highway and you\'re at El Corchito.

258481868.name: Fresh water cenotes in Progreso
258481868.author: a TripAdvisor user
258481868.reviewBody: Relaxing place to cool dawn in a hot day, bring your repellent and some snacks or lunch, not alcoholic beverages are allowed. Its really a nice eco tourist place

255091606.name: Nice place to relax and see mapaches
255091606.author: a TripAdvisor user
255091606.reviewBody: You need to take a little boat (25pesos/person) that takes you there. There are 2 open "cenotes", small size, it\'s a manglar, and you can see different types of fishes and mapaches. Nothing else around.

249120259.name: Trip through the jungle
249120259.author: a TripAdvisor user
249120259.reviewBody: You take a little boat across the river and enter an ominous jungle (it\'s about a 5 minute boat ride). Bring along some food to feed the racoons (they are friendly!!), if you are lucky, you will see an Ant Eater, too! Marvel at the jungle - the way the trees grow and roots upon roots intertwining (it\'s much more beautiful and mesmerizing than my description!). You can swim in one cenote and look at another - the water is crystal clear! Be sure to take some photos of some huge termite nests! (They do not come out and visit, I promise!!). You can spend an hour or the day swimming, it\'s up to you! Bring water and food for yourself as there isn\'t much for sale there, which I wouldn\'t expect in the jungle anyway!
